content: Yes, MoMA has an impressive collection of Weimar Republic art, including works by Expressionist painters such as Kirchner and Beckmann, Bauhaus designers such as Marcel Breuer and Mart Stam, and Surrealist and Dadaist artists such as Duchamp and Magritte. Many of these works are on permanent display, so you can explore them at your leisure. MoMA also hosts temporary exhibitions from time to time that focus on various aspects of Weimar Republic art and culture, so be sure to check their schedule if you're planning a visit.
